places.description: Watch burning buoys float on a river while listening to spa music and eating food. Yep, seriously.
Interact with amazing animals (you can feed the giraffes!), ride the zipline and historic carousel, and take a trip on a paddle boat.
A somewhat dangerous, 3.5 mile walk along the mansion-adorned cliffs of Newport. Spectacular views.
Tour a bunch of snooty old summer homes built partially with slave-trade money that occupy some of the best real estate in the state. Seriously, why do people like this one?
Indulge in a Rhode Island tradition: chowdah and clam cakes after a day at the beach. Iggy's, directly next door, is actually better, but this place is more popular.

Try a unique Rhode Island delicacy: pizza strips. No, they're not just marinara and bread. Yes, they're frickin' delicious. Don't get confused and visit J. Palmieri's Bakery (almost in Johnston), or Palmieri's Bakery (in Providence). Totally different places, nowhere near as good.
The farm team for the Boston Red Sox. Take the whole family out for a game and hot dogs for under $50.
places.location: McCoy Stadium, 1 Columbus Avenue, Pawtucket, RI 02860

places.description: Eat at some of the best restaurants in the state and take a look at the giant metal pine cone (that looks likea pineapple) and find yourself asking, simply, "why?"
